title: mirek92
author: mirek92
content: Hello, I would like to ask, how to see initial liquidity pool value of smart contract?Is it possible to go to first transaction in ethscan or bscscan and there is "add liquidity" transaction. But it is not possible with buge congtracts with lots of transaction. - there is limit of visible transaction in scan pages. So how to check it?Thank you

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.created_time: May 07, 2023, 05:10:39 PMLast edit: May 14, 2023, 05:15:22 PM by yhiaali3
comments.body: There is a limited number on the scan page, but to view the full results you have to click on the title of the smart contract and then click as shown in the image:You will see the full list consisting of many pages, but you have to search manually and this takes time.I don't know if there is a better way to find out.

comments.author: asriloni
comments.body: It's possible to do that. What you can do just try to visit https://info.uniswap.org/# You just need to add the contract address to see that. I will give you an example here https://info.uniswap.org/#/pools/0xa6cc3c2531fdaa6ae1a3ca84c2855806728693e8That address was related to the pools for eth/link and once you are scrolling down, you will able to see these tabsAdds meant liquidity that being added to the pools by the contract owner or liq provider. Uniswap's chart site is also supporting so many blockchain like BSC, Arbitrum even Optimism.It's very easy for you to track liquidity that being added or removed from pools by liq provider.
